page.title: 08A CARPENTER NEAR PLAISH
page.content: I work in the parish producing hardwood furniture of simple and attractive design. I season the trees myself so can buy most of my raw materials from surrounding farms and woodlands. All furniture is madeto order. I supply local pubs - elm and oak lend themselves admirably being rugged but attractive. Local churches and village halls are also regular customers. My work ranges from repairing and constructing gates, to more intricate work - kitchen and shop fitting, using power and hand tools in about equal proportions. Geographically,Cardington is centrally located-most orders are local but a fair number are from further afield. I work mainly on my own but have a young apprentice 3 days a week and my wife helps with the clerical work.
